public_forecast.english_forecast:
Local river and surface water flooding is probable across parts of south-east England today (Thursday) and possible but not expected across south Wales and the rest of the south of England with local river flooding possible in the Cotswolds and Bristol Avon too. River flooding impacts could continue into tomorrow (Friday) in south-east England.

Ongoing local groundwater flooding is expected in parts of Hampshire, West Sussex and Brighton and Hove for the next five days. 

Coastal flooding is not expected despite some strong winds and large waves today (Thursday).

Land, roads and some properties may flood and there may be travel disruption.
public_forecast.welsh_forecast:
Mae llifogydd lleol o afonydd a dŵr wyneb yn debygol ar draws rhannau o dde-ddwyrain Lloegr heddiw (iau) ac yn bosibl ond ni ddisgwylir ledled De Cymru a gweddill De Lloegr gyda llifogydd afonydd lleol yn bosibl yn y Cotswolds a Bryste Avon hefyd. Gallai effeithiau llifogydd afonydd barhau i yfory (Gwener) yn ne-ddwyrain Lloegr.

Disgwylir llifogydd dŵr daear lleol parhaus mewn rhannau o Hampshire, Gorllewin Sussex a Brighton a Hove am y pum diwrnod nesaf. 

Ni ddisgwylir llifogydd arfordirol er gwaethaf gwyntoedd cryfion a thonnau mawr heddiw (dydd Iau).

Gall tir, ffyrdd a rhai eiddo orlifo ac efallai y bydd tarfu ar deithio.

sources.river:
The river flood risk is LOW today (Wednesday).

Minor river flooding impacts are probable across parts of the south-east of England and are expected along parts of the Bristol Avon today, and are possible but not expected more widely across parts of south-central, central and eastern England today, as rivers respond to recent rain.

Due to further rain tomorrow (Thursday), minor river flooding impacts are possible on the Bristol Avon and other catchments in the Cotswolds and Oxfordshire, and are possible but not expected more widely across south Wales and the south-west of England. Rivers in the south-east of England are again likely to respond to rain tomorrow but impacts there are expected to be minimal.

sources.surface:

Minor surface water flooding impacts are possible but not expected across south Wales and the south-west of England tomorrow (Thursday) as heavy rain moves across from the west during the daytime.

sources.coastal:
The coastal / tidal flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.

Despite spells of strong winds and large waves at times today (Wednesday) and tomorrow (Thursday), only minimal coastal flooding impacts are expected.

sources.ground:
The groundwater flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.

Isolated flooding from groundwater has occurred in parts of Hampshire, West Sussex and Brighton and Hove, and minor disruption is expected to continue in these areas for at least the next five days.

Groundwater levels are also high in Dorset, Wiltshire, North Lincolnshire and East Sussex, although impacts here are minimal.

public_forecast.english_forecast:
Local river flooding is probable in the south-east of England today (Wednesday) and is on-going along parts of the Bristol Avon. Local river and surface water flooding is possible but not expected across south Wales and south-west England tomorrow (Thursday) due to further rain with local river flooding possible in the Cotswolds and Bristol Avon.

Ongoing local groundwater flooding is expected in parts of Hampshire, West Sussex and Brighton and Hove for the next five days. 

Coastal flooding is not expected despite some strong winds and large waves today (Wednesday) and tomorrow (Thursday).

Land, roads and some properties may flood and there may be travel disruption.
public_forecast.welsh_forecast:
Mae llifogydd afonydd lleol yn debygol yn ne-ddwyrain Lloegr heddiw (dydd Mercher) ac yn parhau ar hyd rhannau o Fryste Avon. Mae llifogydd lleol o afonydd a dŵr wyneb yn bosibl ond ni ddisgwylir ledled De Cymru a De-orllewin Lloegr yfory (dydd Iau) oherwydd mwy o law gyda llifogydd lleol o'r afon yn bosibl yn y Cotswolds a Bryste Avon.
 
Disgwylir llifogydd dŵr daear lleol parhaus mewn rhannau o Hampshire, Gorllewin Sussex a Brighton a Hove am y pum diwrnod nesaf. 
 
Ni ddisgwylir llifogydd arfordirol er gwaethaf gwyntoedd cryfion a thonnau mawr heddiw (Mercher) ac yfory (dydd Iau).
 
Gall tir, ffyrdd a rhai eiddo orlifo ac efallai y bydd tarfu ar deithio.

sources.river:
The river flood risk is LOW today (Tuesday) and on Wednesday.

Minor river flooding impacts are probable across parts of the south of England  on Tuesday and Wednesday as rivers respond to heavy and persistent rain.

Minor impacts are also possible but not expected more widely on Tuesday and Wednesday across parts of south-central, central and eastern England and in south-east England on Thursday and Friday.

Despite heavy rain into Wales and the west of England on Thursday, only minimal impacts are expected.

sources.surface:
The surface water flood risk is LOW today (Tuesday) and into Wednesday.

Minor surface water flooding impacts are probable across parts of the south of England at times on Tuesday into Wednesday due to heavy and persistent rain, particularly where this falls on wet ground following recent rainfall.

Despite heavy rain into Wales and the west of England on Thursday, only minimal impacts are expected.

sources.coastal:
The coastal / tidal flood risk is LOW today (Tuesday) and on Wednesday.

Minor coastal flooding impacts are probable along parts of the south coast of England and the Isles of Scilly today and into Wednesday. This is due to spring tides combining with strong winds and large waves.

Minor coastal flooding impacts are also possible but not expected today for parts of the south and west coasts of Wales and south-west England, and parts of the  north-east coast of England. Elsewhere only minimal coastal impacts are expected.

sources.ground:
The groundwater flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.

Isolated flooding from groundwater has occurred in parts of Hampshire, West Sussex and Brighton and Hove, and minor disruption is expected to continue in these areas for at least the next five days.

Groundwater levels are also high in Dorset, Wiltshire, North Lincolnshire and East Sussex, although impacts here are minimal.

public_forecast.english_forecast:
Local river and surface water flooding is probable in the south-east of England and possible but not expected more widely in south and central England today (Tuesday) and Wednesday due to spells of heavy rainfall. Local river flooding is also possible but not expected in the south east of England on Thursday and Friday.

Local coastal flooding is probable along parts of the south Cornwall and Isles of Scilly coast today (Tuesday) and along other parts of the south coast of England later on Tuesday and into Wednesday. Local coastal flooding is also possible but not expected for the coasts of Wales, the west and north east of England today (Tuesday). 

Ongoing local groundwater flooding is expected in parts of Hampshire, West Sussex and Brighton and Hove for the next five days. 

Land, roads and some properties may flood and there may be travel disruption.
public_forecast.welsh_forecast:
Mae llifogydd fel canlyniad o ddŵr afon a dŵr lleol yn debygol yn ne-ddwyrain Lloegr ac yn bosibl ond heb eu disgwyl yn ehangach yn ne a chanol Lloegr heddiw (dydd Mawrth) a dydd Mercher oherwydd cyfnodau o law trwm. Mae llifogydd afonydd lleol hefyd yn bosibl ond heb eu disgwyl yn ne ddwyrain Lloegr ar ddydd Iau a dydd Gwener.
 
Mae llifogydd arfordirol lleol yn debygol ar hyd rhannau o arfordir de Cernyw ac Ynysoedd Scilly heddiw (dydd Mawrth) ac ar hyd rhannau eraill o arfordir de Lloegr yn ddiweddarach ar ddydd Mawrth ac i mewn i ddydd Mercher. Mae llifogydd arfordirol lleol hefyd yn bosibl ond heb eu disgwyl ar gyfer arfordiroedd Cymru, gorllewin a gogledd ddwyrain Lloegr heddiw (dydd Mawrth).
 
Disgwylir lifogydd dŵr daear lleol parhaus mewn rhannau o Hampshire, West Sussex a Brighton a Hove am y pum niwrnod nesaf.
 
Gallai dir, ffyrdd a rhai eiddo dioddef llifogydd a gallai fod trafferthion wrth deithio.

sources.river:

Groundwater levels are also high in Dorset, Wiltshire, North Lincolnshire and East Sussex, although impacts here are minimal.

sources.river:
The river flood risk is LOW today (Tuesday) for on-going river impacts.

As rivers continue to respond to recent rainfall, minor river flooding impacts are expected in parts of south-east England and are probable on the lower River Severn today. Local minor river flooding impacts are also possible today from heavy, thundery showers in parts of the south-west England and south Wales and from outbreaks of rain over the East Riding of Yorkshire falling on saturated catchments.

Minor river flooding impacts are possible on Thursday and Friday across parts of much of England and Wales as widespread rain may fall on sensitive catchments.

public_forecast.english_forecast:
Local river flooding is expected to continue in parts of south-east England today and is also probable along the lower River Severn. Local river and surface water flooding is also possible in south Wales and south-west England today and across much of England and Wales on Thursday and Friday.

Local groundwater flooding is expected in parts of Dorset, Wiltshire, Hampshire, West and East Sussex and Brighton for at least the next five days.

Local coastal/tidal flooding is possible but not expected for parts of the English Channel coast today and Thursday.

Land, roads and some properties will flood and there will be travel disruption.
public_forecast.welsh_forecast:
Mae disgwyl i lifogydd o afonydd lleol i barhau mewn rhannau o dde-ddwyrain Lloegr heddiw ac mae hefyd yn debygol ar hyd afon isaf Hafren. Mae llifogydd dŵr afon a wyneb lleol hefyd yn bosibl yn ne Cymru a de-orllewin Lloegr heddiw ac ar draws llawer o Gymru a Lloegr ddydd Iau a dydd Gwener. 

Disgwylir llifogydd dŵr daear lleol mewn rhannau o Dorset, Wiltshire, Hampshire, Gorllewin a Dwyrain Sussex a Brighton am o leiaf y pum niwrnod nesaf. 

Mae llifogydd arfordirol / llanw lleol yn bosibl ond ni ddisgwylir hynny ar gyfer rhannau o arfordir Sianel Lloegr heddiw a dydd Iau. 

Bydd tir, ffyrdd a rhai eiddo yn gorlifo a bydd aflonyddwch teithio.

sources.river:

As rivers continue to respond to recent rainfall, minor river flooding impacts are expected in parts of south-east England and probable on the lower River Severn. Local minor river flooding impacts are also possible on Tuesday from heavy thundery showers in parts of the south of England and the south of Wales and from rain over East Riding of Yorkshire falling on saturated catchments. 

Minor river flooding impacts are possible but not expected on Thursday and into Friday across parts of England and Wales in response to rainfall on sensitive catchments.

sources.surface:
The surface water flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.

Minor surface water flooding impacts are possible in parts of the south of England and the south of Wales later on Monday and into Tuesday, and again on Thursday, due to heavy thundery showers and rain falling on already wet ground.

sources.coastal:

sources.river:
The river flood risk is LOW today (Sunday), Monday and Tuesday.

As rivers continue to respond to recent rainfall, significant river flooding is possible in parts of south-east England today (Sunday). Minor river flooding impacts are also probable in parts of the East Riding of Yorkshire today (Sunday) and are possible elsewhere across other parts of central and southern England. Minor impacts along the middle and lower River Severn are probable today and Monday. 

Minor river flooding impacts are possible in parts of England and Wales on Monday and Tuesday due to further outbreaks of rain, and are expected to continue through sensitive catchments in the south-east of England.

Minor river flooding impacts are then possible across parts of England and Wales on Thursday in response to widespread rainfall.

sources.ground:
The groundwater flood risk is LOW for the next five days.

Local minor groundwater flooding impacts are expected through parts of the south of England (as shown on Area of Concern Map 2) from today (Sunday) for at least the next five days. Levels will continue to rise in these areas due to recent and further rain. Groundwater levels are also high in North Lincolnshire and parts of Oxfordshire although impacts here are still minimal.

sources.surface:
The surface water flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.

Minor surface water flooding impacts are possible in parts of England and Wales later on Monday and into Tuesday, and again on Thursday, due to further spells of rain on already wet ground.

sources.coastal:
The coastal/tidal flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.

Minor coastal flooding impacts are possible but not expected for parts of the English Channel coast at times from today (Sunday) through to Tuesday. This is due to the possibility of strong winds and large waves leading to some local spray and wave overtopping. Further minor impacts are possible but not expected in these areas on Thursday.

statements.future_forecast: Groundwater levels expected to continue rising in Dorset, bringing a risk of further impacts.

public_forecast.english_forecast:
Local river flooding is expected to continue in parts of south-east England today (Sunday) until Tuesday, and is also probable today in parts of the East Riding of Yorkshire. Localised river flooding is probable along the middle and lower River Seven during today and tomorrow. This is due to ongoing river responses following recent rainfall.

Local groundwater flooding is expected in parts of Dorset, Wiltshire, Hampshire, West and East Sussex and Brighton for at least the next five days.

Local river and surface water flooding is possible more widely at times from today until Tuesday and again on Thursday across England and Wales.

Properties could flood and there could be travel disruption.
public_forecast.welsh_forecast:
Bydd llifogydd lleol yn disgwyl i parhau yn rhannau o de-ddwyrain Lloegr heddiw (Dydd Sul) tan Dydd Mawrth ac yn posib heddiw yn rhannau o East Riding of Yorkshire. Bydd lligofydd afonydd lleol yn posib ar hyd ac yr canol ac isaf River Severn heddiw ac fory. Mae hyn oherwydd ymatebion parhaus i'r afon yn dilyn glawiad diweddar. 

Bydd llifogydd dwr ddaear yn diswgyl yn rhannau o Dorset, Wilshire, Hampshire, Gorllewin ac Dwyrain Sussex a Brighton am yr pump dydd nesaf. 
Bydd llifogydd lleol a thwr ar wyneb yn bosib drwy heddiw i ddydd Mawrth ac eto are dydd Iau o gwmpas Lloegr a Chymru. 

Bydd rhai tai yn bosibl o lifo gyda siawns o’r aflonyddwch i deithio

sources.river:
The river flood risk is LOW.

Ongoing significant river flooding is possible in parts of south-east England today (Saturday) and on Sunday as rivers respond to previous rainfall, with some additional contribution from new rainfall tonight. Minor river flooding impacts are probable in other parts of south-east England and along the middle and lower River Severn until Sunday. Ongoing minor impacts are possible more widely today. 

Minor river flooding impacts are possible in parts of England and Wales on Monday and Tuesday due to further outbreaks of rain, and are expected to continue through sensitive catchments in the south-east of England as rivers respond to previous rainfall.

sources.surface:
The surface water flood risk is LOW.

Minor surface water flooding impacts are probable in parts of the south of England through the weekend, and possible more widely. Saturated ground following recent rainfall means impacts may occur after only further modest amounts of rainfall today and tonight.

Further minor surface water impacts are possible in parts of England and Wales on Monday and Tuesday due to outbreaks of rain.

sources.coastal:
The coastal/tidal flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.

Minor coastal flooding impacts are possible but not expected for parts of the English Channel coast at times from today (Saturday) through to Tuesday. This is due to the possibility of strong winds and large waves leading to some local spray and wave overtopping.

sources.ground:
The groundwater flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.

Groundwater levels are rising in Hampshire and West Dorset and minor impacts are possible but not expected over the next five days. Groundwater levels are also high in North Lincolnshire and West Sussex.

statements.headline: Significant river flooding impacts are possible in parts of south-east England today (Saturday) and Sunday. Minor inland impacts are probable more widely through parts of the south of England. The overall flood risk is LOW. See end of FGS for 6-10 forecast.
statements.future_forecast: There is the potential for further unsettled weather at first in this period to bring inland or local coastal flooding issues. Confidence is currently very low however.

public_forecast.english_forecast:
River and surface water flooding is probable in parts of the south and south-west of England today (Saturday) and Sunday due to ongoing river responses and further rain overnight. Local flooding is also possible more widely at times over the next four days across southern and central England and Wales.
Localised flooding will continue along the middle and lower River Seven until Monday and parts of the south-east of England until Tuesday. 

Properties could flood and there could be travel disruption.
public_forecast.welsh_forecast:
Mae llifogydd afonydd a dŵr wyneb yn debygol mewn rhannau o dde a De-orllewin Lloegr heddiw (Sadwrn) a dydd Sul oherwydd effaith parhaus ar afonydd or glaw pellach dros nos. Mae llifogydd lleol hefyd yn bosibl ar adegau yn fwy eang dros y pedwar diwrnod nesaf ar draws De a Chanolbarth Cymru a Lloegr.
Bydd llifogydd lleol yn parhau ar hyd Afon saith tan ddydd Llun a rhannau o dde-ddwyrain Lloegr tan ddydd Mawrth. 

Gallai eiddo orlifo a gallai amharu ar deithio.

sources.river:
The river flood risk is LOW.

Significant river flooding is possible in parts of south east England on the rivers Medway, Mole and Stour through until Sunday as these respond to recent rainfall.

Minor river flooding impacts are probable in other parts of south east of England at times until Sunday as rivers respond to spells of rain.
Minor flooding impacts are also probable along the middle and lower River Severn through until Sunday. 
Saturated catchments following recent rainfall means rivers are responsive to small amounts of rainfall. 

Minor river flooding impacts are possible in the east of England this morning as the rainfall clears this area, and in the south of Wales and south west England on Saturday into Sunday.

Further minor impacts are possible but not expected in parts of England and Wales on Monday and Tuesday due to further outbreaks of rain.

sources.surface:
The surface water flood risk is LOW.

Minor surface water flooding impacts are probable in parts of the south of England at times over the next three days as spells of rain cross the south of England. 
Saturated ground following recent rainfall means impacts may occur after only modest amounts of rainfall.

Minor surface water impacts are possible in the east of England today and in the south of Wales on Saturday into Sunday.

Further minor impacts are possible but not expected in parts of England and Wales on Monday and Tuesday due to further outbreaks of rain.

sources.coastal:
The coastal/tidal flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.

Minor coastal flooding impacts are possible but not expected for English Channel coasts on Saturday, Sunday and Monday. This is due to a possibility of onshore gales and large waves leading to some local spray and wave overtopping.

sources.ground:
The groundwater flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.

Groundwater levels are high in North Lincolnshire and West Dorset, and are rising in Hampshire and West Sussex, though any flooding impacts are expected to be minimal.

statements.headline: Significant river flooding impacts are possible in parts of south east England until Sunday. The overall flood risk is LOW.

public_forecast.english_forecast: Local coastal flooding is possible from today (Friday) to Sunday for parts of the south and west coasts of England and Wales. Local flooding from rivers and surface water is also possible from today to Sunday in parts of the north-west of England. Land, roads and some properties may flood and there may be travel disruption.
public_forecast.welsh_forecast: Mae llifogydd arfordirol lleol yn bosibl o heddiw (dydd Gwener) i ddydd Sul ar gyfer rhannau o arfordiroedd de a gorllewin Cymru a Lloegr. Mae llifogydd lleol o afonydd a dŵr wyneb hefyd yn bosibl o heddiw i ddydd Sul mewn rhannau o ogledd-orllewin Lloegr. Gall tir, ffyrdd a rhai eiddo orlifo ac efallai y bydd aflonyddwch teithio.

sources.coastal:
The coastal/tidal flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.
Minor coastal flooding impacts are possible from Friday to Sunday for parts of the south and west coast of England and Wales. This is due to onshore gales and large waves during a period of high tides leading to some local spray and wave overtopping.

sources.river:
The river flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.
Localised minor river flooding impacts are possible but not expected across parts of the south of England and Wales today (Thursday) and into early Friday due to heavy rain. Despite further spells of rain and showers through the weekend, only minimal impacts are currently expected.

sources.surface:
The surface water flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.
Localised minor surface water flooding impacts are possible but not expected across parts of the south of England and Wales today (Thursday) and into early Friday due to heavy rain. Despite further spells of rain and showers through the weekend, only minimal impacts are currently expected.

sources.ground:
The groundwater flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.
Groundwater levels are high in North Lincolnshire and West Dorset, though any flooding impacts are expected to be minimal.

statements.headline: Minor coastal flooding impacts are possible from Friday to Sunday around parts of the south and west coasts of England and Wales. Flooding from rivers and surface water is possible but not expected today and tomorrow. The overall flood risk is VERY LOW.

risk_area_blocks.additional_information: Gales and large waves may lead to some local spray and wave overtopping.

aoc_maps.title: Specific Area of Concern Map 1: Friday 13 to Sunday 15 December 2019

public_forecast.english_forecast: Local coastal flooding is possible from Friday to Sunday for parts of the south and west coasts of England and Wales. Local flooding from rivers and surface water is possible but not expected today (Thursday) into tomorrow in parts of the south of Wales and the south of England. Land, roads and some properties may flood and there may be travel disruption.
public_forecast.welsh_forecast: Bydd llifogydd arfordirol yn bosib o ddydd Gwener i ddydd Sul yn rhannau de a gorllewin of Lloegr a Chymru. Bydd llifogydd afonydd a thwr ar wyneb un posib ond ddim yn disgwyl heddiw (dydd Iau) mewn i fory yn rhannau o de Cymru a de Lloegr. Bydd tir, ffyrdd a rhai tai yn bosibl o lifo gyda siawns o’r aflonyddwch i deithio.

sources.river:
The river flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.
Localised minor river flooding impacts are possible but not expected across parts of the south of England and Wales on Thursday and into Friday due to heavy rain. Despite further spells of rain and showers through the weekend, only minimal impacts are currently expected.

sources.surface:
The surface water flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.
Localised minor surface water flooding impacts are possible but not expected across parts of the south of England and Wales on Thursday and into Friday due to heavy rain. Despite further spells of rain and showers through the weekend, only minimal impacts are currently expected.

sources.coastal:
The coastal/tidal flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.
Minor coastal impacts are possible but not expected on Saturday for parts of the south and south-west coasts of Wales and also the Somerset and Dorset coasts.  This is due to onshore gales and large waves during a period of high tides leading to some local spray and wave overtopping. At other times, strong winds and large waves for many west and south coasts are not expected to lead to more than minimal impacts.

sources.ground:
The groundwater flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.
Groundwater levels are high in North Lincolnshire and West Dorset, though any impacts are expected to be minimal.

statements.headline: Minor river and surface water flooding impacts are possible but not expected for the south of England and Wales on Thursday into Friday. Minor coastal impacts are also possible but not expected on Saturday. The overall flood risk is VERY LOW.

public_forecast.english_forecast: Local flooding from rivers and surface water is possible but not expected on Thursday into Friday in parts of south Wales and the south of England. Minor coastal flooding is also possible but not expected on Saturday for parts of the south and south-west coasts of Wales and the Somerset and Dorset coasts. Land, roads and some properties may flood and there may be travel disruption.
public_forecast.welsh_forecast: Mae llifogydd lleol o afonydd a dŵr wyneb yn bosibl ond ni ddisgwylir ar ddydd Iau i ddydd Gwener mewn rhannau o dde Cymru a De Lloegr. Mae mân lifogydd arfordirol yn bosibl hefyd ond ni ddisgwylir ddydd Sadwrn ar gyfer rhannau o arfordiroedd De a De-orllewin Cymru ac arfordiroedd Gwlad yr haf a Dorset. Gall tir, ffyrdd a rhai eiddo orlifo ac mae'n bosibl y bydd tarfu ar deithio.

sources.river:
The river flood risk is LOW today and tomorrow (Wednesday).

Minor river flooding impacts are probable across parts of the north of England and possible across Wales and other parts of England today, lasting into tomorrow in some longer river catchments, such as the River Ouse through York and the River Eden. This is due to heavy, persistent rain and localised downpours. Minor river flooding impacts are also possible but not expected elsewhere in England as rivers respond to rainfall on Tuesday.

Minor river flooding impacts are possible but not expected in Wales and the west and south of England on Thursday into Friday due to further outbreaks of heavy rain.

sources.surface:
The surface water flood risk is LOW today.

Minor surface water flooding impacts are probable across parts of the north of England and are possible across Wales and other parts of England today. This is due to heavy, persistent rain and localised downpours.

Minor surface water flooding impacts are possible but not expected in Wales and the west and south of England on Thursday into Friday due to further outbreaks of heavy rain.

sources.coastal: The coastal/tidal flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days despite strong winds, large waves and high tides at times.

sources.ground:
The groundwater flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.

Groundwater levels are high in North Lincolnshire and West Dorset, though any impacts are expected to be minimal.

statements.headline: Minor river and surface water flooding impacts are probable in parts of the north of England and possible in Wales and other parts of England today with on-going river response probable into tomorrow. The overall risk is LOW.

risk_area_blocks.additional_information: Rain falling on already wet catchments. River response continuing into Wednesday.
Widespread heavy rain through Tuesday, with localised downpours.

aoc_maps.title: Specific Areas of Concern Map 1:  Tuesday 10 and Wednesday 11 December 2019.

public_forecast.english_forecast:
Local flooding is probable from rivers and surface water in parts of the north of England today (Tuesday), with some ongoing river flooding probable here into Wednesday. Local river and surface water flooding is also possible in other parts of north England and much of Wales today. Land, roads and some properties could flood and some travel disruption is likely.

Further local river and surface water flooding is possible but not expected on Thursday into Friday in Wales and the west and south of England.
public_forecast.welsh_forecast:
Mae llifogydd lleol yn bosibl o afonydd a dŵr wyneb mewn rhannau o ogledd-orllewin Lloegr heddiw (Dydd Mawrth) gyda rhywfaint o lifogydd afon barhaus yn debygol i mewn i Ddydd Mercher.
Mae llifogydd dŵr afon a dŵr arwyneb lleol hefyd yn bosibl mewn rhannau eraill o ogledd Lloegr a llawer o Gymru heddiw. Gallai tir, ffyrdd a rhai eiddo orlifo ac mae rhywfaint o aflonyddwch teithio yn debygol.

Mae llifogydd dŵr afon a dŵr arwyneb lleol pellach yn bosibl ond ni ddisgwylir ddydd Iau i ddydd Gwener yng Nghymru a gorllewin a de Lloegr.

sources.coastal:
The coastal/tidal flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.

Minor coastal flooding impacts are possible along parts of the east coast of England today (Monday). Strong winds and large waves may lead to some wave or spray over-topping of coastal defences.

sources.surface:
The surface water flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.

Minor surface water flooding impacts are possible across the north west of England and north Wales on Tuesday, and are possible but not expected elsewhere in Wales and the south west of England. This is due to heavy, persistent rain and localised downpours.

Minor surface water flooding impacts are possible but not expected in Wales and the west and south of England on Thursday into Friday due to further outbreaks of heavy rain.

sources.river:
The river flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.

Minor river flooding impacts are possible across the north west of England and north Wales on Tuesday, and are possible but not expected elsewhere in Wales and the south west of England. This is due to heavy, persistent rain and localised downpours.  Minor river flooding impacts are also possible but not expected for parts of the east of England as rivers respond to rainfall on Tuesday.

Minor river flooding impacts are possible but not expected in Wales and the west and south of England on Thursday into Friday due to further outbreaks of heavy rain.

sources.ground:
The groundwater flood risk is VERY LOW for the next five days.

Groundwater levels are high in North Lincolnshire and West Dorset, though any impacts are expected to be minimal.

statements.headline: Minor coastal flooding impacts are possible along parts of the east coast of England today (Monday). Minor river and surface water flooding impacts are possible in the north west of England and Wales on Tuesday. The overall risk is VERY LOW.

risk_area_blocks.additional_information: Strong winds, large waves and some surge.
Widespread heavy rain through Tuesday, with localised downpours.

aoc_maps.title: Specific Areas of Concern Map 2:  Tuesday 10 December 2019.
Specific Areas of Concern Map 1:  Monday 9 December 2019.

public_forecast.english_forecast:
Localised coastal flooding is possible along parts of the east coast of England today (Monday). 

Local flooding is possible from rivers and surface water in parts of north west England and north Wales on Tuesday and possible but not expected elsewhere in Wales, the south west of England and from rivers in parts of the east of England.

Further local river and surface water flooding is possible but not expected on Thursday into Friday in Wales and the west and south of England.

Land, roads and some properties may flood and there may be travel disruption.
public_forecast.welsh_forecast:
Mae llifogydd arfordirol lleol yn bosibl ar hyd rhannau o arfordir dwyreiniol Lloegr heddiw (dydd Llun). 

Mae llifogydd lleol yn bosibl o afonydd a dŵr wyneb mewn rhannau o ogledd-orllewin Lloegr a Gogledd Cymru ar ddydd Mawrth ac yn bosibl ond ni ddisgwylir mewn rhannau eraill o Gymru, De-orllewin Lloegr ac afonydd mewn rhannau o ddwyrain Lloegr.

Mae rhagor o lifogydd mewn afonydd a dŵr wyneb yn bosibl ond ni ddisgwylir ar ddydd Iau i ddydd Gwener yng Nghymru a Gorllewin a De Lloegr.
